intro: Palicourea candida, commonly known as white palicourea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often glossy in appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in umbels, and emit a mild fragrance. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, with various parts used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
